result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett D. La Barge

defendant.name: La Barge, Brett D.
defendant.address: PO Box 444:611 Chicog Street, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: Curfew 7:00 pm to 7:00 am 7 days a week. No abusive contact with Lac du Flambeau Tribal Police employees.  All weapons to be surrendered to Tribal Police or Vilas Sheriff if any are owned.

3:20 PM Defendant Brett D. La Barge in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Brett D. La Barge.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court. State/Defense speak to the motion to modify bond. Court modifies bond to $3,750 CASH with conditions of a curfew 7:00 pm to 7:00 am 7 days a week. No abusive contact with Lac du Flambeau Tribal Police employees.  All weapons to be surrendered to Tribal Police or Vilas Sheriff if any are owned. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:50 AM Defendant Brett D. La Barge appeared by video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Brett D. La Barge.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM Defendant Brett D. La Barge in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not contacted the public defender.  Court advises to do so.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Conditions no contact with Lac du Flambeau Tribal Police Chief Bill and Officer Allen.  All weapons to be surrendered to Tribal Police or Vilas Sheriff.

1:46 PM Defendant Brett D. La Barge appeared by video, in custody Vilas County Jail. ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of complaint. Court reads charge. Right to counsel explained to defendant.  Court hears from State. Court sets bond $7500.00 cash, Conditions no contact with Lac du Flambeau Tribal Police Chief Bill and Officer Allen.  All weapons to be surrendered to Tribal Police or Vilas Sheriff.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
